<|channel|>analysis<|message|>We have already read Settlement Agreement and Status Update. We extracted five May 5, 2022 dates from Settlement Agreement. Also the Status Update includes settlement dates: "presented to the Governor on or before May 12, 2022, and signed into law on or before May 17, 2022." Also "presented to Governor on or before May 12, 2022" and "signed into law on or before May 17, 2022." Also possibly "May 5, 2022" as the date the letters were filed. So we need to extract all distinct settlement-related dates: execution, signing, court approval, amendment dates, enforcement dates, termination/expiration dates. For the Settlement Agreement, the parties executed on May 5, 2022. That is the signing date. Also maybe "May 5, 2022" appears multiple times, but same date. So we should add an entry: "May 5, 2022: Agreement executed". Also from Status Update: "May 12, 2022: Settlement Maps presented to the Governor" and "May 17, 2022: signed into law". Also "May 5, 2022" as the date the letter was filed. That may be a status update date, not necessarily settlement event but it's a date of a filing, but might count as "Settlement Maps presented to the Governor on or before May 12, 2022" and "signed into law on or before May 17, 2022". Also maybe "April 19, 2022" as agreement in principle date. That is a settlement event: "agreement in principle" might be considered settlement event. The requirement: "The settlement-related dates, including execution/signing date(s), court approval dates (if approved but not entered as an order), amendment dates, enforcement/retention dates without incorporation, and termination/expiration dates of the settlement agreement (if contractual). Do not include any date once the settlement (in whole or in part) is incorporated into a judgment or order." So April 19, 2022: agreement in principle. That's a settlement-related date. Similarly, May 5, 2022: the letter filing date is not necessarily settlement event but letter refers to agreement. But still may be considered a settlement event? It's the date of the status update. But the requirement doesn't exclude it. But better to include only settlement-related events. So we have:

- April 19, 2022: Parties reached agreement in principle.
- May 5, 2022: Agreement executed (Settlement Agreement executed).
- May 12, 2022: Settlement Maps presented to Governor (court approval? Actually legislative approval).
- May 17, 2022: Settlement Maps signed into law.

Also from Settlement Agreement: "May 5, 2022" appears three times but same event. So one entry.

Thus we need to append these entries. The evidence for each: For April 19, 2022: from Status Update: "On April 19, 2022, SC NAACP and House Defendants reached an agreement in principle." For May 5, 2022: from Settlement Agreement: "Date: May 5, 2022" with parties signatures. Also from Status Update: "May 5, 2022" as filing date, but that might be separate. But we can include one entry for May 5, 2022: Agreement executed. For May 12, 2022: from Status Update: "presented to the Governor on or before May 12, 2022". For May 17, 2022: from Status Update: "signed into law on or before May 17, 2022".

We must create separate entries for each unique date with event description. Each entry: value string: "[date]: [settlement event]". Provide evidence block.

Thus we need to call append_checklist with patch key Date_of_Settlement and extracted entries. Since we have multiple entries, we can include them all in one call. Evidence for each: we need text snippet, source_document, location. We'll provide location as page or line context. For Settlement Agreement: location page 7 or 1? The snippet shows page 7. We'll say "Page 7 of 7". For Status Update: we need page 1 for April 19, 2022 and page 1 for May 12, 2022 and May 17, 2022. Use location "Page 1 of 4" etc.

Now need to produce JSON with append_checklist.<|end|><|start|>assistant<|channel|>commentary to=functions.append_checklist <|constrain|>json<|message|>{
  "patch": [
    {
      "key": "Date_of_Settlement",
      "extracted": [
        {
          "value": "April 19, 2022: Agreement reached in principle",
          "evidence": [
            {
              "text": "On April 19, 2022, SC NAACP and House Defendants (“the Parties”) reached an agreement in principle to resolve their litigation about the House redistricting plan.",
              "source_document": "Status Update Regarding Settlement by Legislation",
              "location": "Page 1 of 4"
            }
          ]
        },
        {
          "value": "May 5, 2022: Settlement Agreement executed",
          "evidence": [
            {
              "text": "Date: May 5, 2022",
              "source_document": "Settlement Agreement and Release",
              "location": "Page 7 of 7"
            }
          ]
        },
        {
          "value": "May 12, 2022: Settlement Maps presented to Governor",
          "evidence": [
            {
              "text": "presented to the Governor on or before May 12, 2022",
              "source_document": "Status Update Regarding Settlement by Legislation",
              "location": "Page 1 of 4"
            }
          ]
        },
        {
          "value": "May 17, 2022: Settlement Maps signed into law",
          "evidence": [
            {
              "text": "signed into law on or before May 17, 2022",
              "source_document": "Status Update Regarding Settlement by Legislation",
              "location": "Page 1 of 4"
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}
